column4: here's a question - since compositing/compiz makes watching videos of any resolution horrible, and I hate to do the metacity --replace since it consolidates my carefully placed windows on desktop 1, can I launch a second instance of X without compositing for purposes of gaming/watching video? If so, what is the best way to do so?
Yes, start a second xserver on the :1 port.
startx -- :1 in one of the F1-F6 consoles?
Yes, start there.  Use F8 instead.   F1-F6 usually have a getty running.
wow that didn't work very well. switching back crashed X
Sorry,  I meant put the second X server on F8 when you get the desired configuration.  Ubuntu puts the default X server on F7.
You're doing something that almost nobody else wants.  The proprietary fglrx and nvidia drivers could be unstable.
Well, that hardware has some of the best drivers.
If possible, find a tolerable compiz configuration.
How is the video quality currently unacceptable?
running video on composited X is awful
Okay, yeah, you're screwed 720p on Intel HD.
still think running lightweight X without compositing might do the trick
